Title: Data Analyst - EU Marketing
Description:
About the team:

We are on a mission to build the ultimate go-to-market engine. To help us to achieve our mission, we are seeking a Data Analyst to strengthen the Global Analytics Team and support SumUp's strategic Marketing initiatives. This role partners with Marketing leadership to identify business needs, then construct data models, generate reports and dashboards, offer advanced analysis and actionable insights to drive improvement in our online channels. You will make a significant contribution to the business by being a valued business partner, a member of an experienced data team and by actively participating in the development of the analytics chapter.

What you'll do:


Create efficient data models that track Online Marketing funnel performance and KPIs, from ad spend to product activation.
Use data to drive analysis and actionable recommendations to shape Marketing program design, operations, and strategy
Partner with Marketing leadership and Strategic Finance to set performance targets, define KPIs, create scalable reporting and forecasts, and provide insight to drivers of pacing against goals
Collaborate closely with Senior Leadership to develop and evaluate Marketing strategies based on data-aware insights and qualitative analysis
Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Marketing teams as well as SumUp Leadership
Drive strategic data OKRs aligned with SumUp's business goals, such as ICP analysis and readout
Partner with Analytics Engineers to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and accessible for analytics


You’ll be great for this role if you have:


A good understanding of marketing data flows, processes and industry level analytical practices (attribution models, cohorts)
Experienced in an analytical role at a high-growth tech company, including at least 1 year of hands-on experience with data analytics, data model design, dbt, and collaborative development using Git
Hands-on experience in developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau
The ability to analyze Online Marketing and GTM needs and turn them into KPIs, insights, data models, and dashboards
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to identify trends and key insights from unclear data.
Excellent communication skills and a strategic mindset to effectively collaborate with leadership
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to apply quantitative analysis and logical reasoning to inform and influence business decisions


Why you should join SumUp:

🌍 Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.

🌈 Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced

📚 A dedicated annual L&D budget of €2,000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education.

🚀 Enrolment onto our VSOP program: You will own a stake in SumUp’s future success

💶 A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

🔄 30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp.

🔗 Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team.

🚵🏾‍♂️ Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We’re the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Data Analyst Valuation (m/w/d)
Description:
GEMEINSAM ERFOLGREICH

Sie suchen eine neue Herausforderung? Sie möchten Ihre Karriere in eine neue Richtung lenken? Sie möchten etwas bewegen?

Unser Data Intelligence & Digital Enablement Team in Deutschland schafft durch den Einsatz von Daten, Technologien und innovativen Lösungen echten Mehrwert für unser Business. Wir treiben die digitale Transformation des Unternehmens voran, managen zentrale Enterprise Applikationen und unterstützen unsere operativen Business- und Research-Teams bei der Erweiterung, Pflege, Konsolidierung, Analyse und Visualisierung einer einzigartigen Immobiliendatenlandschaft.

Für unser Team suchen wir ab sofort einen Data Analyst Valuation (m/w/d) in Berlin, Hamburg oder Frankfurt am Main.

IMMOBILIEN – WIR MACHEN DAS

CBRE ist – in Bezug auf den Umsatz im Geschäftsjahr 2024 – der größte globale Immobiliendienstleister. Mit mehr als 140.000 Mitarbeitern in über 100 Ländern steht CBRE Investoren und Immobiliennutzern als Partner für alle Immobilienbelange weltweit zur Seite. Wir bieten unseren Kunden ein breites Spektrum an integrierten Leistungen aus einer Hand – über den gesamten Lebenszyklus einer Immobilie hinweg.

DAS MACHEN SIE BEI UNS


(Weiter-)Entwicklung und Verwaltung zentraler Business Intelligence (BI) Produkte für den Geschäftsbereich Valuation Advisory Services
Bearbeitung der hoch priorisierten neuen Anwendungsfälle aus dem Anforderungskatalog der Bewertungsplattform mithilfe von Datenbankabfragen und BI Tools, in enger Abstimmung mit dem Data Engineering Team
Migration bestehender automatisierter Reports und Dashboards von der deutschen Legacy-Plattform (PostgreSQL) in die neue CBRE Continental Europe Data Platform (Snowflake)
Überprüfung und gegebenenfalls Neuentwicklung existierender Datenmanagement-Prozesse sowie Optimierung der Dateninfrastruktur
Dokumentation bestehender und zukünftiger datenbezogener Anwendungsfälle, insbesondere hinsichtlich der automatischen Befüllung der Kalkulationsmodelle
Erstellung eines Datenkatalogs inklusive Data Lineage und Business Glossary
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Continental Europe Data Teams zur Anpassung regionaler Tools an den lokalen Kontext
Selbstständige und proaktive Weiterbildung sowie Recherche zu relevanten Themen der Immobilienbewertung unter Nutzung interner und externer Ressourcen


DAS HABEN SIE ZU BIETEN


Erfolgreicher Bachelor-Abschluss in Immobilienwirtschaft, Betriebswirtschaft, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder vergleichbaren Studiengängen
Fachkenntnisse und/oder Praxiserfahrung in der Immobilienwirtschaft oder Finanzbranche mit Fokus auf agiles IT Project Management
Idealerweise erste praktische Erfahrungen im Kontext von Dokumentenmanagement und KI
Grundkenntnisse in der Nutzung von Projektmanagement Tools (z.B. Smartsheet, Monday, MS Project, Jira, Azure DevOps) sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Office365 (Excel, Powerpoint, Teams, OneNote)
Hervorragende schriftliche und verbale Kommunikationsfähigkeit auf Deutsch und Englisch; sehr gute organisatorische und analytische Fähigkeiten; effiziente und verlässliche Arbeitsweise; gute Präsentationsfähigkeit


DAS BIETEN WIR IHNEN


Wir machen flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten möglich: Egal ob im Büro, zu Hause, unterwegs oder während einer Workation
Werden Sie Teil des einzigartigen CBRE-Spirits und profitieren Sie von schnellen Entscheidungswegen und Duz-Kultur
Bleiben Sie mobil mit unserem Fahrtkostenzuschuss zum ÖPNV
Durch das offene high-end Bürokonzept leben wir täglich unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Augenhöhe
Erfolge zusammen feiern! Dafür gibt es Gelegenheit bei regelmäßigen Team-Events
Profitieren Sie von weiteren Benefits wie Familienservice, Corporate Benefits, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sonderkonditionen für Fitnessstudios, JobRad u.v.m


MACHEN SIE MIT?

Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte! - Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung über unser Online-Bewerbungssystem, inklusive Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen leider keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen können.

Bei Rückfragen zur Stellenanzeige wenden Sie sich gerne per E-Mail an unser Talent Acquisition Team: bewerbung@cbre.com

  • Bleiben Sie mobil mit unserem Fahrtkostenzuschuss zum ÖPNV
  • Durch das offene high-end Bürokonzept leben wir täglich unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Augenhöhe

  • Profitieren Sie von weiteren Benefits wie Familienservice, Corporate Benefits, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sonderkonditionen für Fitnessstudios, JobRad u.v.m

MACHEN SIE MIT?

Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte! - Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung über unser Online-Bewerbungssystem, inklusive Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen leider keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen können.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
We at Friendsurance

We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities


Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.


How You Will Contribute


Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value


By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!

Your profile


5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.


We as a Team

We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.

At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.

Our offer


100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!


Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application <3

About Us

Friendsurance is a Berlin-based Insurtech company, providing easy-to-use innovative insurance solutions for B2C clients and B2B partners.

With partners like Deutsche Bank and Allianz, Friendsurance ist the N°1 bancassurance platform provider in Europe. We work with 7 bancassurance partners, connecting 175 insurers and 50 million addressable users.

Ready to join us?

HTML:
We at Friendsurance

We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities

  • Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
  • Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
  • Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
  • Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
  • Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
  • Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
  • Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
  • Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
  • Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
  • Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.

How You Will Contribute

  • Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
  • Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
  • Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
  • Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value

By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!

Your profile

  • 5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
  • Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
  • Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
  • Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
  • Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
  • Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
  • Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
  • Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
  • Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
  • A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
  • Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
  • Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.

We as a Team

We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.

At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.

Our offer

  • 100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
  • Flexible and family-friendly working hours
  • A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
  • A generous personal development budget for all employees
  • Legendary team events and parties
  • Language classes
  • Urban Sports membership subsidy
  • Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
  • A unique and international team
  • A people-focused management
  • And much more!

Friendsurance is a Berlin-based Insurtech company, providing easy-to-use innovative insurance solutions for B2C clients and B2B partners.

With partners like Deutsche Bank and Allianz, Friendsurance ist the N°1 bancassurance platform provider in Europe. We work with 7 bancassurance partners, connecting 175 insurers and 50 million addressable users.

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Do you think in data, recognize patterns where others only see numbers, and turn complex analyses into clear recommendations for action? Then you’ve come to the right place! We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who will take our data-driven decision-making to the next level with precise analyses and smart dashboards – creating real value for our company.







These tasks await you here:




Develop, maintain, and optimize Power BI dashboards and reports to support essential decision-making processes
Analyze internal and external data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization
Ensure data integrity and guarantee that all BI tools provide reliable and accurate information
Define and implement KPI-driven success metrics to evaluate the performance of our business processes
Collaborate closely with various departments (Operations, Finance, Sales, Real Estate Management) to develop and enhance data-driven solutions
Support colleagues in effectively using BI tools and foster a data-driven mindset within the company




Your profile:




A degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or a related field
2-5 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or a similar role
Strong expertise in Power BI (DAX, data modeling, dashboard development) and Excel (pivot tables, complex formulas, data analysis tools, preferably macos)
Experience with SQL, APIs, ERP/CRM systems, ETL processes, and Data Warehousing is a plus – particularly in handling structured and unstructured data from diverse sources and integrating them into powerful BI systems
Knowledge of real estate market data and relevant KPIs is an advantage
Excellent English skills, ideally also German skills




This is what you can expect from us:




Learning Effects and Responsibility: A role with diverse tasks, a high degree of creative freedom, and ample opportunities for self-fulfillment
Teamwork & Diversity: Amazing team members you can rely on. We recognize the benefits of diverse teams and an inclusive corporate culture, which is why fostering diversity is a key part of our corporate strategy for the future
International Collaboration: Work alongside motivated colleagues in growing international teams
Personal Development: With a personalized development plan and continuous training, you’ll achieve your goals with us
Security: A permanent employment contract and a competitive salary package, including an annual bonus and regular salary adjustments
Leisure: 30 vacation days per year, plus additional special leave on December 24th and 31st
Fun and Benefits: Regular team events and workshops, as well as employee discounts
Show more

Title: Salesforce Developer
Description:
Salesforce Developer – Commerce Focus

Berlin

Hybrid (3 days onsite)







Are you an experienced Salesforce Developer with a passion for e-commerce and expertise in Salesforce Order Management System (OMS)? Join a leading force in the gaming and tech industry, where we create cutting-edge online shopping experiences.




The Role

As a Salesforce Developer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and optimizing Salesforce Commerce Cloud and OMS solutions. Your work will directly impact online store performance, order management processes, and customer experience.




What You’ll Be Doing

Salesforce Commerce Cloud Development – Build and maintain scalable e-commerce solutions.
OMS Optimization – Streamline order processing, fulfillment, inventory, and returns.
Customization & Integration – Develop APIs and integrate third-party systems (payment gateways, shipping providers).
Performance Tuning – Enhance system efficiency for seamless customer journeys.
Collaboration – Work with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative e-commerce solutions.




What We’re Looking For

3+ years of Salesforce Development experience with a focus on Commerce & OMS.
Strong skills in Apex, Visualforce, JavaScript, and web technologies.
Knowledge of e-commerce best practices and trends.
Experience with Git, Agile methodologies, and API integrations.
Passion for gaming and tech is a plus.




Location




What’s in It for You?




Competitive salary & benefits package
Work with cutting-edge e-commerce technology
Career growth and development opportunities
A collaborative and innovative work environment




Interested? Apply now or reach out for more details.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

What is the role about?


Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
The Tools We Use:
Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you’re stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can’t wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.
Show more

Title: Energy Data Internship (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
Description:
What To Expect
The Energy Team continuously monitors and manages the utility systems, ensuring they meet the process specifications for vehicle production. The team is also responsible for forecasting the factory’s Energy requirements, continuously designing and implementing strategies and improvements to ensure optimum energy performance of the factory, working on energy efficiency improvements.

As an intern, you will work with many interfaces within the energy team and have contact with various stakeholders within the factory. Your main task would be to establish a working dashboard which forecasts factory’s Energy usage. This dashboard will then be a major tool used by the team in making key decisions.

Start Date: February / March 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg

What You'll Do


Understanding Manufacturing processes in the factory and its effect on Energy usage
Coordinating with Manufacturing Shops to gather information that affects Energy usage
Coordinating with the Technical Service to gather information that affects Energy usage
Build a working Machine learning model based dashboard for forecasting Electricity and Gas usage for short term and long term
Establish data transfer protocol to automize data infeed into the dashboard. For Eg – automatic input for outside weather condition, automizing
Communicating with other teams to understand the internal softwares used by Tesla
Identifying and establishing a workflow to keep the dashboard always updated/maintained



What You'll Bring


Your working style is proactive, pragmatic and fast-paced
Master’s (preferred) or a bachelor’s degree in Energy Data Engineering or similar
Experience in managing and analyzing large Energy datasets and utility demand forecasting
Advanced programming skills in Python or R.
Basic knowledge of electrical engineering and thermodynamics is a plus.
Experience with data integration and validation techniques (SCADA).
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to work in a large, complex environment where you must adapt to meet company needs



, Tesla

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Our Story




At think-cell, we create powerful software solutions that help professionals be more efficient and productive. Founded in 2002 and based in Berlin, our tools integrate seamlessly with Microsoft Office to help users create presentations, charts, and diagrams with ease. Our dynamic, international team values creativity, collaboration, and technical excellence.




How your role will look like:




You collaborate with business owners to understand their objectives, strategies, and KPI requirements to translate them into data solutions and actionable insights
You design and implement business logic, data models and visualizations by using various methods and technologies such as SQL, Python and BI tools
You contribute to a valuable, robust and performant data platform by e.g. optimizing code, debugging anomalies and writing documentation




You will be great for this position if you have

At least 8 years of working experience in a Data Analytics environment, ideally in a similar business (Online / eCommerce)
Strong general knowledge of “how to work with data”, e.g. statistical methods, data preparation & visualization, transfer from data via analyses into actionable insights
Advanced data analytics experience with using e.g. Python or R and very good SQL skills
Experience in data modelling and BI-Tool experience, ideally PowerBi and understanding of data architecture concepts
Experience in working with Google Analytics / Matomo data
Experience in Git
Solid understanding of tracking concepts (frontend/backend)
Solid A/B testing experience
Strong ability to work both independent and as a part of the team
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Well structured, detail-oriented working style with a passion for efficient documentation
Desire to succeed as a team by creating synergies over individual success
Capable of outlining and presenting complex issues in an easy-to-understand manner
Great understanding of eCommerce businesses (products & challenges)
Very good language skills in English and optionally also in German




Our Values




As part of our team, you will embody and help shape the following principles that define us:




Forward Thinking: We embrace change and challenge the status quo.
Ownership: We take pride in our work and learn from our mistakes.
Customer First: We prioritize delivering lasting value.
Unified Team: We foster collaboration, respect, and integrity.
Strive for Excellence: We set ambitious goals and pursue quality.




Why is think-cell the right place for you?




We empower over 1.2 million users across 30,000 companies, including top consulting firms and major global enterprises. With offices in Berlin, Denver, Boston, London, Tokyo, and Dubai, we’re a diverse team of over 150 people, committed to innovation and excellence.




Think-cell is more than a job – it's a chance to be part of an innovative, inclusive team that values collaboration and growth. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. Together, we can shape the future of productivity software. We can’t wait to see what you’ll bring to the team!

Show more
HTML:
Our Story


At think-cell, we create powerful software solutions that help professionals be more efficient and productive. Founded in 2002 and based in Berlin, our tools integrate seamlessly with Microsoft Office to help users create presentations, charts, and diagrams with ease. Our dynamic, international team values creativity, collaboration, and technical excellence.


How your role will look like:


  • You collaborate with business owners to understand their objectives, strategies, and KPI requirements to translate them into data solutions and actionable insights
  • You design and implement business logic, data models and visualizations by using various methods and technologies such as SQL, Python and BI tools
  • You contribute to a valuable, robust and performant data platform by e.g. optimizing code, debugging anomalies and writing documentation


You will be great for this position if you have

  • At least 8 years of working experience in a Data Analytics environment, ideally in a similar business (Online / eCommerce)
  • Strong general knowledge of “how to work with data”, e.g. statistical methods, data preparation & visualization, transfer from data via analyses into actionable insights
  • Advanced data analytics experience with using e.g. Python or R and very good SQL skills
  • Experience in data modelling and BI-Tool experience, ideally PowerBi and understanding of data architecture concepts
  • Experience in working with Google Analytics / Matomo data
  • Experience in Git
  • Solid understanding of tracking concepts (frontend/backend)
  • Solid A/B testing experience
  • Strong ability to work both independent and as a part of the team
  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Well structured, detail-oriented working style with a passion for efficient documentation
  • Desire to succeed as a team by creating synergies over individual success
  • Capable of outlining and presenting complex issues in an easy-to-understand manner
  • Great understanding of eCommerce businesses (products & challenges)
  • Very good language skills in English and optionally also in German


Our Values


As part of our team, you will embody and help shape the following principles that define us:


  • Forward Thinking: We embrace change and challenge the status quo.
  • Ownership: We take pride in our work and learn from our mistakes.
  • Customer First: We prioritize delivering lasting value.
  • Unified Team: We foster collaboration, respect, and integrity.
  • Strive for Excellence: We set ambitious goals and pursue quality.


Why is think-cell the right place for you?


We empower over 1.2 million users across 30,000 companies, including top consulting firms and major global enterprises. With offices in Berlin, Denver, Boston, London, Tokyo, and Dubai, we’re a diverse team of over 150 people, committed to innovation and excellence.


Think-cell is more than a job – it's a chance to be part of an innovative, inclusive team that values collaboration and growth. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. Together, we can shape the future of productivity software. We can’t wait to see what you’ll bring to the team!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About This Position

Are you passionate about turning raw data into strategic insights that drive business success? Do you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you have the autonomy to shape and scale data infrastructure?

Then heyData is your next stop!

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in managing our data infrastructure, developing scalable data models, and providing actionable insights to teams across the company. You'll ensure data-driven decision-making and foster a data-first culture.

Your mission


Manage & Optimize BI Infrastructure: Own and maintain our end-to-end BI setup, which currently includes Airbyte, dbt, Snowflake, and Metabase. Continuously evaluate and implement the best tools to meet our evolving needs.
Develop Scalable Data Models: Build and maintain reliable, scalable data models that ensure data integrity and accuracy across all business functions.
Drive Strategic Insights: Analyze business performance metrics, identify trends, and provide actionable recommendations to leadership and various teams.
Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product, marketing, and sales teams to understand data needs and support data-driven decision-making.
Mentorship & Alignment: Upskill junior team members and ensure that data strategies align with the company’s vision and goals.
Ensure Data Governance: Implement and uphold data governance policies and industry best practices to maintain compliance and security.


What we are looking for?


5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL, Snowflake, Redshift, etc.).
Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Metabase, or similar.
Knowledge of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into meaningful business insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with dbt is a plus.
Good knowledge of Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Experience in a startup or fast-paced environment is a plus.


Why heyData?


Join a fast-growing startup on a mission to become a leader in compliance.
Clear career development opportunities and the chance to take ownership from day one, with a flexible learning budget.
Work alongside a highly motivated team with backgrounds in top-tier consulting, startups, venture capital, and law firms.
Flexible working options: Whether in our beautiful office in the heart of Berlin-Mitte or remote – work in the way that suits you best.
Team events and culture: Regular events in Berlin and exciting team offsites.
State-of-the-art IT equipment, 30 days of annual leave, and attractive benefits such as support for the Deutschlandticket, Urban Sports Club membership, or a company pension plan.


About Us

At heyData, we are determined to serve our mission: making Compliance easy for everybody!

At heyData, we're not just a company; we're a movement. We're reshaping the way small and medium-sized businesses embrace compliance. We set up European employees on track to reach compliance in the fastest, most intuitive, and seamless way possible. Think of us as the superheroes of compliance, and we've only just begun. With over one thousand customers we are one of the largest SMB compliance platforms in Europe and are expanding further.

But here's the real kicker – you get to learn from a world-class team across Europe and contribute to a game-changing compliance solution that's set to revolutionize millions of SMBs. So, are you ready to be part of this incredible journey and do the most exciting work of your life? Let's make compliance history together! #heyDataLife

If the idea of making an impact excites you as much as it does us, then heyData is where you belong. This is your chance to leap into the adventure of a lifetime and set your career on fire! Reach out to us, and let's blaze a trail together in the world of business innovation! #JoinheyData

At heyData, we're proud to be a vibrant and diverse startup. We celebrate and embrace people from all backgrounds, including diverse gender, age, sexuality, religion, ethnicity, disability status parental status, and more to apply to our roles. Our team thrives on the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings. We're committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone can succeed. The more diverse and inclusive we are as a team, the greater our work will be.

Title: Werkstudent:in (w/m/d) Retail Data Analyst
Description:
WER WIR SIND




WRSTBHVR wurde 2014 mit der Mission gegründet, Konfektionsstücke mit Streetwear-Ästhetik und Designelementen zu kombinieren, ohne Kompromisse bei der Qualität einzugehen.

Von Berlin aus entwickelt unser junges Team, neue Styles, die den Zeitgeist der Jugendkultur in die Welt transportieren. Mittlerweile hat sich WRSTBHVR international als Marke etabliert, die für Qualität, Design und Authentizität steht.




Wir suchen ab sofort eine:n motivierte:n Werkstudent:in (m/w/d) im Bereich Data & Analytics, der unser Team tatkräftig unterstützt. Wenn Du Dich für Zahlen, Analysen und betriebswirtschaftliche Prozesse begeisterst und praktische Erfahrungen in einem dynamischen Arbeitsumfeld sammeln möchtest, bist Du bei uns genau richtig!




DEIN PROFIL




Du bist eingeschriebene:r Student:in (m/w/d) in einem wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Studiengang, idealerweise mit Schwerpunkt Controlling, Finance oder Accounting
Kommunikationsstärke, Teamfähigkeit sowie eine proaktive und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise zeichnen Dich aus
Neben einem routinierten Umgang mit MS Office bringst Du ausgezeichnete organisatorische Fähigkeiten mit, zusätzlich kennst du dich mit der Nutzung von Apple Soft- und Hardware aus
Sehr gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Excel
Ein freundliches und professionelles Auftreten
sehr gute Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
strukturierte und selbstständige Arbeitsweise, hohe Auffassungsgabe und Flexibilität
Eine analytische Denkweise, eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise sowie hohe Zahlenaffinität zeichnen Dich aus.




DEINE AUFGABEN




Identifizierung und Setzen aktiver Steuerungsimpulse durch Verkaufs-, Bestands- und Kostenanalysen
Durchführung von Ad-hoc-Analysen sowie komplexen Auswertungen
Managementgerechte Aufbereitung und Vortragung von Ergebnissen
Implementierung von Kontrollverfahren
Du führst selbstständig Datenanalysen durch
Du entwickelst Modelle zur Aufbereitung von Daten mittels Excel & PowerBI
Du unterstützt beim Aufbau einer unternehmensweiten Datenarchitektur
Du entwickelst Dashboards zur Datenvisualisierung
Du bereitest Analyseergebnisse adressatengerecht auf und kommunizierst diese intern




WIR BIETEN

einen abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsplatz im Herzen von Berlin
transparente Unternehmenskultur als Teil eines motivierten Teams
eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten und dynamische Entwicklungsperspektiven
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Benefits und Zusatzleistungen
Ein offenes und tolerantes Arbeitsumfeld, in dem jeder willkommen ist




Wenn wir dein Interesse geweckt haben, sende eine aussagekräftige Bewerbung mit nächstmöglichem Eintrittstermin an mj@worst-behavior.com. Erste Bewerbungsgespräche auch via Teams. Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Title: Environmental Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location: Berlin

Your tasks


Collecting, processing, and handling energy and water data for ESG/non-financial reporting.
Supporting the analysis and implementation of digital solutions and procedures for data collection and reporting.
Training operational teams and other departments on new processes and tools for data management.
Coordinating with multiple departments to manage incoming energy data from various sources.
Ensuring completeness and performing quality checks on incoming energy data.
Assisting in developing reports and analysis to support business decisions.
Implementing and ensuring compliance with reporting standards (e.g., CSRD, EU taxonomy).



Your profile


Master’s degree in engineering, energy, environmental sciences, or economic sciences.
Minimum 1 year of relevant work experience.
Strong analytical skills, self-driven, and highly motivated.
Proficiency in MS Excel and good knowledge of MS Office.
Experience with environmental data management tools is a plus.
Familiarity with reporting standards such as CSRD, EPRA, GRI, and CDP is beneficial.
Knowledge of real estate, including residential, commercial, and hospitality sectors.
Excellent communication skills in both English and German.



Your perspective


Interesting, varied and broad range of tasks in one of the largest real estate companies in Germany and Europe
Good working atmosphere, communication culture “on a first-name basis” and a pleasant working atmosphere in an environment with flat hierarchies
Individual training and coaching for professional and personal development in our Academy and with our in-house business coach
Professionally equipped, in-house gym with trainers and courses at the headquarters in Berlin as well as fitness and health offers through the Wellhub platform at all external locations
Comprehensive company health management and company pension scheme
Support on the way to work through a subsidy for the use of public transport and the option of leasing a bicycle through Eurorad
Modern IT equipment such as laptop and cell phone
Mobility and flexibility through the use of pool cars and company cars to carry out tasks
Flexible working hours and mobile working for an even better work-life balance
Exciting virtual range of family-friendly benefits, including vacation programs, leisure and sports activities and consulting services with our partner company Voiio
Opportunity to attend Bundesliga matches of FC Union Berlin, our favorite club
Discounts in selected hotels worldwide with up to 30% on overnight stays and special conditions on food and drinks
Employee discounts for special conditions in the areas of media, fashion, leisure, facilities and much more via a partner company
Drinks and a selection of fruit



Have we sparked your interest?

Then click on "Apply Now" below, and Maryam Al-Dolaimy looks forward to receiving your compelling application documents, including your earliest possible start date and salary expectations.

Aroundtown, Personalabteilung, Wittestraße 30, Haus F, 13509 Berlin

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data based at our HQ in Berlin - Schöneberg, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ years’ experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: You’ll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe’s automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: BI-Consultant (m/w/d) - Remote oder Berlin
Description:
Business Intelligence, Corporate Performance und Data Management sowie Controlling und Finanzen: Bei diesen sehr daten- und zahlen­getriebenen Herausforderungen unterstützen wir bei der xax mit einem über 70-köpfigen Team an 5 Standorten deutschlandweit Unternehmen mit der Digitalisierung ihrer individuellen Reporting-, Analyse- und Planungs­prozesse. Von der passenden Tool-Auswahl und der Anforderungsaufnahme über die erfolgreiche Implementierung ihrer individuellen Lösung auf Basis professioneller Software-Werkzeuge bis hin zu Schulungen, Coachings und laufendem Projekt-Support erhalten unsere Kunden seit über 20 Jahren bei uns alles aus einer Hand.




Zur Verstärkung unseres Berliner Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen BI-Consultant - gern auch zu 100% remote, in Voll- oder Teilzeit.




Was wir Dir bieten:




Spannende, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, wie bspw.:

Eigenständige Gestaltung von kundenspezifischen BI-Lösungen (Reporting, Planung) unter Einsatz unterschiedlicher BI-Software (u.a. Infor, Board, Jedox, MS Power BI).
Erstellung individueller ETL-Prozesse, relationaler Data Warehouse-Architekturen sowie multidimensionaler Datenbanklösungen unter Nutzung leistungsfähiger BI-Werkzeuge (u.a. DataVault Builder, MS SSIS).
Direkte Kundenkommunikation, fachliche und technische Anforderungsaufnahme und Beratung.
Die Möglichkeit, Deine Stärken und Ideen individuell einzubringen und zu verwirklichen, um Dich dadurch weiter zu entwickeln.
Ein Team mit starkem Zusammenhalt, das Dir für Fragen und Unterstützung zur Verfügung steht.
Vom ersten Tag an eine Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe mit jedem Teammitglied.
Schnelle Entscheidungsprozesse mit viel Platz für neue Ideen.
Flexible und angenehme Arbeitsbedingungen, wie z.B. Home-Office / Remote-Möglichkeiten.




Was Du mitbringst:




Ausgeprägte Dienstleistungsorientierung und hohe Zuverlässigkeit.
Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene IT-nahe Ausbildung (z. B. als Kaufmann/-frau für IT-System-Management) oder ein Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik – alternativ bringst du eine vergleichbare Qualifikation für diese Position mit.
Erste Erfahrung im Customizing gängiger BI-Systeme (wie z.B. MS Power BI, Infor, Qlik, Board, Jedox o.ä.)
Grundlegendes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis sowie erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement.
Tatendrang, Eigeninitiative sowie Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen.
Die Fähigkeit, im Team als auch Kunden gegenüber offen, zielgerichtet und lösungsorientiert zu kommunizieren.
Den Anspruch, Dein Wissen stets zu erweitern, Neues zu lernen sowie Dich und Deinen Erfolg selbstbestimmt zu organisieren.
Großes Interesse an regelmäßigem Feedback.
Verantwortlicher Umgang mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit.
Authentisches Auftreten sowie viele Ecken und Kanten.
Ein sehr gutes Ausdrucksvermögen in der deutschen Sprache.




Interesse?




Wir freuen uns über Deine Bewerbung (im PDF-Format) unter Angabe Deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

Show more
HTML:
Business Intelligence, Corporate Performance und Data Management sowie Controlling und Finanzen: Bei diesen sehr daten- und zahlen­getriebenen Herausforderungen unterstützen wir bei der xax mit einem über 70-köpfigen Team an 5 Standorten deutschlandweit Unternehmen mit der Digitalisierung ihrer individuellen Reporting-, Analyse- und Planungs­prozesse. Von der passenden Tool-Auswahl und der Anforderungsaufnahme über die erfolgreiche Implementierung ihrer individuellen Lösung auf Basis professioneller Software-Werkzeuge bis hin zu Schulungen, Coachings und laufendem Projekt-Support erhalten unsere Kunden seit über 20 Jahren bei uns alles aus einer Hand.


Zur Verstärkung unseres Berliner Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen BI-Consultant - gern auch zu 100% remote, in Voll- oder Teilzeit.


Was wir Dir bieten:


Spannende, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, wie bspw.:

  • Eigenständige Gestaltung von kundenspezifischen BI-Lösungen (Reporting, Planung) unter Einsatz unterschiedlicher BI-Software (u.a. Infor, Board, Jedox, MS Power BI).
  • Erstellung individueller ETL-Prozesse, relationaler Data Warehouse-Architekturen sowie multidimensionaler Datenbanklösungen unter Nutzung leistungsfähiger BI-Werkzeuge (u.a. DataVault Builder, MS SSIS).
  • Direkte Kundenkommunikation, fachliche und technische Anforderungsaufnahme und Beratung.
  • Die Möglichkeit, Deine Stärken und Ideen individuell einzubringen und zu verwirklichen, um Dich dadurch weiter zu entwickeln.
  • Ein Team mit starkem Zusammenhalt, das Dir für Fragen und Unterstützung zur Verfügung steht.
  • Vom ersten Tag an eine Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe mit jedem Teammitglied.
  • Schnelle Entscheidungsprozesse mit viel Platz für neue Ideen.
  • Flexible und angenehme Arbeitsbedingungen, wie z.B. Home-Office / Remote-Möglichkeiten.


Was Du mitbringst:


  • Ausgeprägte Dienstleistungsorientierung und hohe Zuverlässigkeit.
  • Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene IT-nahe Ausbildung (z. B. als Kaufmann/-frau für IT-System-Management) oder ein Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik – alternativ bringst du eine vergleichbare Qualifikation für diese Position mit.
  • Erste Erfahrung im Customizing gängiger BI-Systeme (wie z.B. MS Power BI, Infor, Qlik, Board, Jedox o.ä.)
  • Grundlegendes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis sowie erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement.
  • Tatendrang, Eigeninitiative sowie Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen.
  • Die Fähigkeit, im Team als auch Kunden gegenüber offen, zielgerichtet und lösungsorientiert zu kommunizieren.
  • Den Anspruch, Dein Wissen stets zu erweitern, Neues zu lernen sowie Dich und Deinen Erfolg selbstbestimmt zu organisieren.
  • Großes Interesse an regelmäßigem Feedback.
  • Verantwortlicher Umgang mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit.
  • Authentisches Auftreten sowie viele Ecken und Kanten.
  • Ein sehr gutes Ausdrucksvermögen in der deutschen Sprache.


Interesse?


Wir freuen uns über Deine Bewerbung (im PDF-Format) unter Angabe Deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

Title: Open Application
Description:
Founded in 2020, Y42 is a fast-growing company of 70+ ambitious and dedicated experts from all over the world who are on a mission to reshape the data space. We are backed by some of the world's most renowned investors, having raised $34m in funding (Series A + seed round). This enabled us to build one of the largest tech and product teams across all European Series A-funded startups with 50+ team members.

We work together to create an environment for people with open minds who want to grow and have an impact. Being a part of Y42 means constant growth and opportunity. We are all highly ambitious yet united in our mission to succeed as a team. Here, you can truly explore and redefine your own potential. We believe it is crucial for everyone here to find purpose in what they do, thrive, and feel like they belong. That is why we invite you to learn more about what it's like to work here

Joining Y42 means joining our mission and contributing to our growth. A lot of what we are doing is unexplored, which means that you will find yourself doing things you haven't done before. You might just discover skills you didn't know you had.

People who are eager to reach their full potential can use this environment as a professional playground and become the most excellent version of themselves!

If this speaks to you, we strongly encourage you to send us an unsolicited application and let us know how you picture yourself contributing to the Y42 story and why. We will carefully check for any upcoming projects or challenges and get back to you with feedback.

About you

It doesn't matter whether you're still in school or have already held C-level positions. We have created entirely new roles for some of our wonderful talents in the past, and we will continue to do so. Everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences.

The typical hiring process at Y42:

Application review

Screening call

Interview with hiring manager

Cultural fit interview

Reference check

Offer

As soon as a suitable role becomes available, we will reach out to you. To make this process faster, we would like to know a few things about you.

Title: Junior Data Engineer- Berlin - 60k
Description:
Junior Data Engineer- Berlin - 60k




Your Responsibilities:

Defining and implementing requirements for the design and operation of an XML database.
Conducting formal and content analysis of structured documents intended for storage in the database.
Developing and implementing validation routines and search functionalities within the database.
Supporting companies in standardization-related processes by delivering high-quality, efficient standards information.




Your Qualifications:

Completed degree in information science, documentation, computer science, IT, or a similar field.
Strong knowledge of database systems, architectures, and maintenance (NoSQL, SQL).
Baseline proficiency in programming: Java or Python.
Understanding of web services, service-oriented architectures, and associated technologies (HTML, HTTP, REST, JSON).
Very nice to have: XML technologies (XML, XPath, XSL, XQuery), but not essential.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a talent for developing innovative solutions.
Ability to collaborate across teams, combined with initiative and a results-oriented approach.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in both German and English.




What We Offer:

35-hour workweek (full-time).
Maxi-Flex option: Possibility to increase weekly hours to a maximum of 42 hours/week.
Flexible working hours
Remote working opportunities.
30 vacation days per year, plus company holidays between Christmas and New Year.
Centrally located offices
Access to onsite physiotherapy, subsidies for VBB company tickets, JobRad options, sabbatical opportunities, a subsidized company restaurant, company pension plans, and more.
Comprehensive onboarding, training, and ongoing support.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Title: (Junior) Insights Analyst (mensch)
Description:
Über uns

Getreu unserem Motto – People is what makes us us – sind uns deine nachhaltige Ausbildung und Weiterentwicklung, deine ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance und deine Happiness sehr wichtig. Konkret stellen wir mit 32 Urlaubstagen, 60 % mobilem Arbeiten, bis zu 4 Wochen pro Jahr – im europäischen Ausland – der Möglichkeit remote zu arbeiten, Sabbatical und Überstundenausgleich sicher, dass dir im FUSE-Agentur-Leben nichts fehlt.

In unserem derzeit über 60-köpfigen Team sowie unseren Kund*innen haben wir unser perfektes Match bereits gefunden. Wenn du noch auf der Suche bist, bei „popkulturellem Relevanzmarketing“ neugierig wirst und für Social Media, Influencer Marketing oder Gaming & Esports brennst, dann lass uns zusammen loslegen! Denn : Action Creates Impact .

Dein Job

Als (Junior) Insights Analyst (mensch) bearbeitest du als Teil unseres Data und Analytics Teams in erster Linie die Anfragen unserer Kunden nach Social Media Reportings sowie Social Listening Analysen und beherrschst den Spagat zwischen analytischem und kreativem Denken, um die Kolleg:Innen in deinem und anderen Teams mit datenbasierten Insights zu Kundenmeinungen, Märkten, Zielgruppen, Marken und ihren Social Media-Umfeldern zu versorgen.

Dein Aufgabenbereich

Datenbeschaffung / Toolbedienung

Du bist präzise, schnell, zuverlässig und motiviert, wenn es um die manuelle Erfassung großer (Social Media)- Datenmengen geht, aber auch wissbegierig und begeisterungsfähig, dich diesbezüglich kontinuierlich mit Prozessoptimierung zu befassen, sowie dich in Tools und automatisierte Datenerfassungsprozesse und Methoden einzudenken, um immer bessere Lösungen zu finden.

Datenstrukturierung, Effiziente Datensammlung, Query Writing, Kategorisierung und Datendarstellung werden hier deine täglichen Begleiter.

Studiendurchführung

Von der (manchmal noch recht schwammigen) Fragestellung bis zum fertigen Analysebericht mit guten Insights und Handlungsempfehlungen ist es oft ein weiter aber spannender Weg. Der kann bald auch deiner sein, gemeinsam mit uns im Team.

Du hast ein sehr gutes Gespür für Sprache und Kommunikation? Nice, das brauchst du hier in mindestens dreierlei Hinsicht: Erstens, um aus den Aussagen und Briefings unserer Auftraggeber herausfiltern zu können, wie du ihnen am besten weiterhelfen kannst. Zweitens, wenn es darum geht, die Essenz von Konsumenten-Posts und Kommentaren auf Social Media zu verstehen, schließlich ist Inhaltanalyse unser Daily-Business. Und Drittens, um dann Deine Findings Zielgruppengerecht rüberzubringen - in Reports, in Meetings und bei Präsentationen.

Datenanalyse

Auswertungslogiken passend zu den gegebenen Fragestellungen und Erkenntnisinteressen erstellen, Dimensionierungen & Kategorisierungen für Inhaltsanalysen planen und entwickeln, Daten auszählen, filtern, darstellen, vergleichen, interpretieren, daraus kreative Idee und Empfehlungen ableiten. Das ist dein Playground. Deine Affinität zu Zahlen und Daten kannst du hier immer wieder beweisen. Ein stets strukturiertes Vorgehen und ein souveräner Umgang auch mit großen und komplexen Datenmengen, Statistiken und Zahlen sind für dich selbstverständlich.

Spezielle Social Media Analyse-Tools wirst Du ebenso (kennenlernen und) zum Einsatz bringen wie ganz viel Excel und das gute alte Powerpoint.

Das bringst du mit

Du kannst (erste) Erfahrung in der qualitativen und quantitativen Forschungsarbeit, sowie in der marketing- oder kundenorientierten Projektarbeit vorweisen und hast Lust dich im Bereich Social Media Analytics weiter auszutoben. Du hast, dank deines Studiums, einen kommunikations-, sozial- oder medienwissenschaftlichen Background und bringst Kenntnisse der Methoden im Bereich der quantitativen und qualitativen Marktforschung mit. Du hast neben den analytischen Fähigkeiten, auch ein Gespür für gute kreative Kommunikation und Lust, diese mitzuentwickeln. Du bist organisiert und selbständig, willst aber auch noch ständig ganz viel lernen und verstehst dich als Teamplayer, der immer auf Höhe des Zeitgeists ist und daraus neue Impulse für unsere Teams und Kunden ableitet. Außerdem hast Du sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, sehr gute MS Office Kenntnisse, insbesondere Excel und PowerPoint und bist im besten Fall mit Analytics Tools im Bereich Social Listening & Web Analytics vertraut.

Darum wir

Als Teil der FUSE erfährst du stets Rückenwind von deinem Team, arbeitest für Kunden - die unsere Werte „BOLD. TRUE. EASY. TOGETHER.“ leben und kannst aktiv Prozesse und Strukturen mitentwickeln. Denn ganz getreu unserem Wert TOGETHER setzen wir auf das Potential im Team. Neben unvergesslichen Events bieten wir dir viel Raum für persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung.
Show more
