HTML:
Join Our Mission: Help the Helpers with Jane

Let’s kick things off with a quick intro. Jane is a team that’s all about fostering growth, spreading delight, and serving our healthcare community. We’re looking for people who are ready to jump in and join us as we simplify the lives of healthcare practitioners and patients every day.

At Jane, success means collaborating with your team, delivering an aligned result with efficiency and quality, communicating clearly and openly, and embracing continuous improvement. And guess what? Jane is a remote-first company, so every role, including this one, gives you the freedom to work from anywhere in Canada.

Your Role In Our Journey

Jane is looking for a Data Analyst who will be responsible for delivering consistent, meaningful insights across the company with a focus on supporting our Product and Marketing teams. You will have strong experience with SQL, dbt, Looker and preferably experience in a fast growing software company. We're looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys working with stakeholders to solve business problems, and is excited about working with data that drives business impact. You’ll have the opportunity to shape how Jane uses data to improve product adoption, customer retention, and marketing efficiency. At Jane, we value transparency, ownership, and a problem-solving mindset. If you’re excited about working with data to unlock business insights and help shape decision-making, this could be the perfect role for you.

Learn More About Us

We're founder-led, which means we live our values while maintaining a clear vision for the future. Our product enables the likes of physiotherapists, mental health counsellors, chiropractors, and other allied health practitioners to run their practices in a digital-first way through features such as online booking, charting, scheduling, telehealth, secure payments and billing along with an evolving library of features. You can see more of them here .

We're a company that is growing rapidly, and with that comes the challenge of navigating an environment with many moving parts, often without a clear-cut path laid out in front of us. If you're the kind of person who gets a kick out of being resourceful and loves solving problems, we would love to hear from you.

No doubt, Jane's a special place to work. There is autonomy and flexibility to help integrate work into your life in a way that makes sense for you. Need to block out time to pick up the kids? Go for it. That's normal here. And yes, we have a Slack channel for parents, but we've also got channels dedicated to plants, furry friends, food, pride, wellness - you get the idea! While we love to connect virtually, the Jane team also connects in person throughout the year.

We believe in collaboration, humility, and keeping a growth mindset. We're looking for people who can embrace our way of working, which often means being flexible and open to change. So, if after reading this, you feel excited about the opportunity — all in the name of helping those who help others — reach out to us to learn more.

You can also learn more about Jane as a company and a product by checking out our Glassdoor reviews and our Capterra Reviews

If you're excited by our growth, ready to contribute to a challenging yet rewarding environment, and eager to be a disruptor alongside a team of talented individuals, we’d love to hear from you!

  • Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Experience with Github/version control.

Bonus Points

  • Experience with Snowflake and Tableau
  • Familiarity with product and/or marketing KPIs (e.g., churn, LTV, CAC, feature adoption)
  • Experience with event tracking data like RudderStack.
  • Experience with SQL query optimization and performance tuning
  • Familiarity with different data architectures (e.g., star vs snowflake schema)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Clutch

Clutch is Canada’s largest online used car retailer, delivering a seamless, hassle-free car-buying experience to drivers everywhere. Customers can browse hundreds of cars from the comfort of their home, get the right one delivered to their door, and enjoy peace of mind with our 10-Day Money-Back Guarantee… and that’s just the beginning.

Named one of Canada’s top growing Companies two years in a row and also awarded a spot on LinkedIn’s Top Canadian Startups list, we’re looking to add curious, hard-working, and driven individuals to our growing team.

Headquartered in Toronto, Clutch was founded in 2017. Clutch is backed by a number of world-class investors, including Canaan, BrandProject, Real Ventures, D1 Capital, and Upper90. To learn more, visit clutch.ca.

What You'll Do


Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights that drive business decisions.
Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations to track KPIs and operational performance.
Work cross-functionally with teams to define key business metrics and improve data-driven decision-making.
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
Support marketing and growth initiatives by analyzing campaign performance, customer behavior, and funnel conversion rates.
Partner with product and engineering teams to improve data quality, accessibility, and reporting capabilities.
Craft compelling data stories that clearly communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders, enabling confident, data-driven decisions.


What We're Looking For


4+ years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or a related role.
Strong SQL skills with experience querying large datasets.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI.
Experience with Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Familiarity with cloud-based data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift) is an asset.
Hands-on experience with data modeling concepts and techniques, including designing data structures that support reporting, analytics, and business logic.
Ability to translate complex data into clear insights and recommendations.
Strong problem-solving skills with a data-driven mindset.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work effectively across teams.
Experience in an e-commerce, marketplace, or automotive industry is a plus.


Why You’ll Love It At Clutch


Autonomy & ownership -- create your own path, and own your work
Competitive compensation and equity incentives!
Generous time off program
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Sr. Data Analyst

Level: Mid-Senior

Location: Remote (Candidates must be based in Toronto, Ontario, Canada).




eLocal, part of Brookfield Asset Management, is a fast-growing and profitable national leader in pay-for-performance digital advertising. We connect millions of local consumers each year to the businesses they need, when they need them. We're fast-growing, and we want you to join our journey! We are looking for a talented Sr. Data Analyst, to join our BI Team remotely from anywhere in Canada.




About the Role:

As Sr. Data Analyst, you will lead initiatives to build dashboards and business intelligence solutions in support of business operations across eLocal. Reporting to the Manager, Data & Analytics, your day-to-day will involve end-to-end design and development of reports from a wide array of data sources. You will be responsible for setting up data pipelines, transforming raw data into usable formats, creating and defining KPIs, as well as designing visually engaging dashboards. You will leverage a variety of tools and programming languages such as Qlik, dbt, SQL, AWS S3, Amazon Redshift, and Excel to unlock the value of our data. Your work will improve the quality of reporting at eLocal, enabling more accurate data, faster analysis, and smarter decision making for strategic and operational initiatives.




The ideal candidate will be a skilled long-tenured data analyst, BI developer, or data engineer. We are looking for someone who is a technical expert with a proven track record of simplifying and automating reporting processes. The candidate is an independent worker, passionate about data, curious about the digital advertising/home services industry, and eager to make a difference with great data storytelling. We are a Qlik shop – we prefer candidates with hands-on experience in Qlik, but we will also consider candidates with a strong background in other BI tools that are willing to learn Qlik.




Responsibilities:

Build dashboards, scorecards, and reports to tell a data story through charts and visualizations.
Analyze and query raw data using SQL from our data warehouse and databases.
Combine data from multiple data sources and aggregate data across different dimensions.
Automate and reduce manual data entry to improve accuracy and turnaround times.
Streamline reporting processes by migrating Excel reports into BI platforms and moving transformations upstream into the data warehouse.
Write and refactor code to be more efficient in both our BI platform and data warehouse.
Collaborate with business department stakeholders to understand information needs and define deliverables.
Guide stakeholders to action via concrete, data-driven recommendations from your dashboards.
Train company-wide users on the use of self-serve dashboards and how to obtain relevant recommendations for their line of work.
Partner with Engineering to improve data infrastructure and quality, as well as drive data governance and data literacy initiatives.
Become the subject matter expert around our sales, call, finance, and marketing data.
Sharing best practices and providing technical guidance on a highly collaborative, high performing analytics team.




Requirements and Skills:

4-7 years working in a relevant data/analytics role
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a business or technical discipline (e.g. analytics, math, physics, engineering, finance, or computer science)
Proficiency with BI/reporting tools. Preference given to prior experience with Qlik, other tools such as Power BI or Tableau also considered.
Expert SQL (Redshift, PostgreSQL) skills. Knowledge of Python is a plus but not required.
Hands-on experience with data processing and building end-to-end data workflows (Extract, Transform, Load)
Strong analytical skills and mindset, able to clearly explain your methodology to a non-technical audience
Knowledge of digital marketing, call center, and Salesforce/CRM data is a plus
Knowledge of the home services industry is a big plus
Experience with project management tools (like JIRA), documentation tools (like Confluence),
and data dictionaries/catalogs (like dbt and Collibra)
Excellent communication and facilitation skills, proven track record of building strong relationships
Grit, accountability, and ownership- you’re willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic
Strong business acumen with the ability to successfully navigate varied asks from different departments, and translate business requirements into data needs
Self-directed and resourceful, can think critically, troubleshoot and solve complex problems in a fast-paced, data-driven, metrics-oriented environment
High attention to detail while handling multiple, simultaneous projects under deadline pressure




Why Join eLocal?




We still use our Philadelphia, US area office for meetings, collaboration, and socializing, but we are proudly a virtual-first environment. Since 2020, we have been a certified Great Place to Work™ with 91% of our employees saying that they would strongly recommend the organization to friends and family as a great place to work. Additionally, we offer an extremely generous benefits package that reflects our values.

Show more

Title: Data & Analytics Specialist
Description:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization. Flexdrive is a subsidiary of Lyft that works together with Lyft teams to realize our shared mission.

Lyft is looking for a Data Analyst for Lyft’s Fleets and Driver Operations Business Analytics team. This team provides support on a wide range of projects that can be technically or operationally focused across subject matters such as niche Fleets within Lyft’s driver supply pool & Regulatory Operations. In this role, you’ll investigate issues, influence business decisions with data and build reporting/tools to keep our business running smoothly. The ideal candidate - You have technical skills, a business-oriented mindset, are a problem solver and enjoy a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:


Work with business partners to manage performance, create operational rigor and proactively seek ways to improve the business
Build reporting/dashboards w/ visualizations to develop insightful & actionable information that supports decision making (this requires using SQL + Gsheets in your day-to-day)
Support multiple initiatives & stakeholders at once, requiring the ability to prioritize based on expected business outcomes


Experience:


Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
3+ years of experience in a business analytics role for a complex business
Proficient in SQL and Google Sheets / Excel
Ability to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization (ideally within the tech industry)
Outstanding interpersonal and stakeholder management skills with a proven ability to work cross functionally
Operationally-focused, process-oriented, data-driven, and simply able to get stuff done
Ability to communicate clearly & write thorough, scalable and clear documentation
Track record in driving influence within the business
Previous experience in P&L/financial models is a plus


Benefits:


Extended health and dental coverage options, along with life insurance and disability benefits
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
Child care and pet benefits
Access to a Lyft funded Health Care Savings Account
RRSP plan to help save for your future
In addition to provincial observed holidays, salaried team members are covered under Lyft's flexible paid time off policy. The policy allows team members to take off as much time as they need (with manager approval). Hourly team members get 15 days paid time off, with an additional day for each year of service
Lyft is proud to support new parents with 18 weeks of paid time off, designed as a top-up plan to complement provincial programs. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible.
Subsidized commuter benefits


Note: For this role, candidates must reside in states registered for Flexdrive Services LLC.

This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule — Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year. #Hybrid

The expected base pay range for this position in the Toronto, CA area is $76,000-$95,000 CAD. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Range is not inclusive of potential equity offering, bonus or benefits. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.

Flexdrive is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Flexdrive does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal law. Flexdrive also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Flexdrive will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
It’s an exciting time to be at OSL Retail Services, working for a people focused company that’s at the top of its game. The momentum we’ve generated in recent years with our commitments to client customers, innovation, business results, and an entrepreneurial spirit has created energy, enthusiasm, and engagement among our employees that is pushing us to new heights. And we’re on the lookout for talented people who share our vision and values and want to join us in this journey. At OSL, our culture is our foundation. Passionate employees, great customer service and long-term relationships are all built upon that foundation. We value people, passion, honesty, respect, and integrity.




The Company:

OSL was established in 2012 in Mississauga, Ontario, to provide clients with customized designed sales solutions in retail, direct sales, merchandising and customer acquisition.




About the role:

Reporting to the Manager, Data Governance and Engineering, the Data Analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design. Data Analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.




Responsibilities:

Maintain and monitor production system alerts and provide triage support for priority systems/processes.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases
Maintain and monitor ETL processes currently running and create the new ones if required.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and clean data by reviewing reports.
Provide reports and data support to the other departments.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Document the new processes




Who we’re looking for:

3+ years experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical knowledge of data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases, SQL, PostgreSQL
Knowledge of programming (python or R) or ETL tools (Alteryx or Knime) is an asset.
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent organizational, written & verbal communication skills
Confidence and ability to work in a highly visible, fast-paced environment with minimal supervision, capable of delivering quality results with high expectations of workload output
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics an asset




What’s in it for you:

Competitive base salary $60-70K +bonus
RRSP matching program
Vacation plus additional flex days
Comprehensive health, dental and life benefits
Training and development opportunities to grow your career
Named one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies
A supportive workplace culture and work environment
Employee development programs




If this sounds like you and you’re excited to be a member of our team, please apply now.




We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted. This position requires successful completion of a criminal background check.

It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.




OSL is committed to an inclusive workplace that does not discriminate against race, nationality, religion, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
It’s an exciting time to be at OSL Retail Services, working for a people focused company that’s at the top of its game. The momentum we’ve generated in recent years with our commitments to client customers, innovation, business results, and an entrepreneurial spirit has created energy, enthusiasm, and engagement among our employees that is pushing us to new heights. And we’re on the lookout for talented people who share our vision and values and want to join us in this journey. At OSL, our culture is our foundation. Passionate employees, great customer service and long-term relationships are all built upon that foundation. We value people, passion, honesty, respect, and integrity.




The Company:

OSL was established in 2012 in Mississauga, Ontario, to provide clients with customized designed sales solutions in retail, direct sales, merchandising and customer acquisition.




About the role:

Reporting to the Analytics Manager, the Business Intelligence Analyst is a skilled analytical professional who has significant hands-on experience with analysis, reporting, and dashboarding. You will be responsible for creating and developing metrics, identifying opportunities in the business, and shaping the vision for reporting and analysis at OSL.




What you’ll do:

Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and build/maintain ETL workflows and dashboards
Filter and clean data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and correct problems and validate data accuracy
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends in complex data sets and provide easily digestible reports and actionable business insights
Examine reporting relationships to increase end-user productivity, availability, and accuracy
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Assist in identifying opportunities in business and works to produce impactful analysis
Liaise with internal and external clients on reporting needs to find effective solutions
Develop and build datasets using SQL/ETL tools and create automated dashboards and alerts
Support the team by creating reports - ad hoc or routine - and dashboards




What you’ve done:

3+ years BI experience
Proven working experience as a business data analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing, data visualization and presenting findings
Strong knowledge of and experience with dashboarding (PowerBI, Tableau, or Domo), databases (SQL etc), ETL Tools (Knime, Alteryx).
Programming with Python or Javascript is an asset
BS in Business, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics an asset




What we offer:

A competitive base salary of $70-$85K plus bonus
Vacation plus additional flex days
Comprehensive benefits
RRSP matching program
Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies
A supportive workplace culture and work environment







If this sounds like you and you’re excited to be a member of our team, please apply now.




We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted. This position requires successful completion of a criminal background check.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Company

At Canopy Growth, our mission is clear: improve lives, end cannabis prohibition, and strengthen communities. We believe that cannabis can be a force for good. We’re building a consumer-centric organization that is focused on sharing the transformational potential of cannabis with the world. We will achieve this through an innovative and disruptive portfolio of cannabis and hemp-derived products.

Canopy Growth is the world's leading cannabis and hemp company. We recognize that employees are at the core of our success, and we take pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity.

Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue our incredible momentum of growth. If you are interested in building global challenger brands, scaling a business, and working in a values-driven environment, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst with strong experience in Master Data, Microsoft Power BI and ERP systems to join our Data Engineering & Analytics team. The ideal candidate will have expertise in master data management, reporting, data modeling, enabling them to deliver actionable insights and support business decision-making.

Responsibilities

Master Data Management (MDM) & Governance


Develop and implement master data management (MDM) strategies to ensure data consistency, accuracy, and integrity.
Define and enforce data governance policies, including data ownership, stewardship, and quality standards.
Manage master data domains (e.g., customers, vendors, products, financial data) across the organization.
Work closely with business teams to define data definitions, taxonomies, and hierarchies.
Monitor data quality metrics, identify anomalies, and implement corrective actions.
Collaborate with IT and business teams to establish data integration and synchronization processes.
Support ERP master data migration, consolidation, and cleansing efforts.
Ensure consistency and integrity of master data across ERP and other business systems.


ERP Data Analysis & Reporting


Work with ERP systems, preferably Sage X3, to extract, analyze, and report on key business data.
Ensure accurate and seamless data integration between the ERP system and other enterprise applications.
Identify opportunities for data automation and process improvement related to ERP reporting.


SQL & Database Management


Write, optimize, and troubleshoot complex SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Develop and maintain stored procedures, functions, views, and triggers to support analytics and reporting needs.
Perform data cleansing, validation, and normalization to ensure accuracy and consistency across databases.
Work with relational databases such as SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle to support data analysis requirements.
Implement indexing, partitioning, and performance tuning techniques to enhance query efficiency.
Ensure data security, integrity, and compliance when handling sensitive business data.


Power BI Reporting & Data Visualization


Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports using Microsoft Power BI to provide business insights.
Work with DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) to create calculated columns, measures, and aggregations.
Build and manage Power BI data models, including defining relationships, hierarchies, and calculated tables.
Implement row-level security (RLS) to restrict access to sensitive data within Power BI reports.
Optimize Power Query (M Language) transformations to efficiently process and shape data from multiple sources.
Publish, maintain, and schedule Power BI reports and datasets using Power BI Service.
Integrate Power BI with other data sources, APIs, and cloud-based solutions (e.g., AWS, Snowflake).
Conduct user training and support for Power BI report consumers.


Experience


Bachelor’s/College degree in computer science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, and reporting.
Strong SQL proficiency, with experience in writing and optimizing complex queries, stored procedures, and performance tuning.
Advanced Power BI skills, including DAX, Power Query (M), data modeling, and Power BI Service administration.
Experience with ERP systems (preferably Sage X3) for data extraction, integration, and reporting.
Knowledge of data modeling techniques (e.g., star schema, snowflake schema, dimensional modeling).
Understanding of master data management (MDM) principles and data governance.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Knowledge of cloud-based data platforms (AWS, Snowflake) is a plus.


Other Details

This is a full-time role based out of Ontario.

We appreciate your interest, and promise to review all applications, but we will only be contacting those who best fit the requirements.

We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require accommodation, please notify your Talent Acquisition Partner. Please note, the chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of cloud-based data platforms (AWS, Snowflake) is a plus.

Title: Intern, Data Analyst
Description:
Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group Ltd.

Toronto, ON

Interested in joining one of Canada’s largest private asset managers ? We are looking for a Data Analyst (Intern) for a summer internship starting May 2025 to join our Data & Insights Team. As a Data Analyst , you will play a crucial role in maintaining and updating our CRM database (Salesforce) with accurate and timely information. Your attention to detail and ability to work efficiently will contribute to the smooth operation of our organization . Our offices currently operate on a hybrid model with a combination of in office and remote working days throughout the week.

What You Will Do


Monitor and maintain data quality within Salesforce, ensuring accurate, complete, and up-to-date records across different objects (e.g., accounts, contacts, opportunities).
Verify and cross-check data for errors or inconsistencies.
Analyze Salesforce data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization, and communicate findings to senior analysts or managers. Ensure data integrity and security.
Support the Manager to work with sales, marketing, and operations teams to understand their data needs and provide actionable reports.
Help document processes for reporting and data management within Salesforce, and support initiatives for continuous improvement in data handling and analytics.


What You Will Bring


Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Business, Information Technology, or a related discipline (or equivalent work experience).
Familiarity with Salesforce or other CRM platforms (experience with Salesforce is a plus).
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel including functions, formulas, and data visualization tools.
Ability to interpret and analyze data to make business recommendations.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to present data insights clearly and concisely.
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving and organizational skills.
Willingness to learn new tools, technologies, and industry best practices.


To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter as one PDF.

About Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group

At Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group, we understand the value of opportunity – for our clients and our team. Independent and employee-owned, we partner with investment professionals to grow successful asset management businesses, giving them the space to innovate and truly make an impact.

With more than 40 years of history and offices across Canada and in the US, the UK and India, CC&L Financial Group and our multi-boutique family of affiliate firms collectively manage over $139 billion in assets, providing a diverse range of traditional and alternative investment products and solutions to institutional, high-net-worth and retail clients.

For a closer look at how you can build your career with us, we invite you to explore www.cclgroup.com .

CC&L is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or age.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, but only those candidates shortlisted for interviews will be contacted. No telephone calls or recruitment agencies will be accepted.

Apply for this Position

Title: Data Analyst (Contract)
Description:
Our client is a global leader in professional services, providing financial and advisory solutions to businesses across industries. With a strong reputation for innovation and excellence, they are seeking a Data Analyst to join their team on a 6-month contract.




Responsibilities:




Design and developer Power BI dashboards and reports
Analyze and connect data lake structures
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify data requirements and transform them into insights
Translate complex data into intuitive visualizations that enhance decision-making
Ensure the accuracy and reliability of all data




Qualifications:




Experience as a Power BI / Data Analyst
Ability to connect front-end visualizations with back-end data sources
Expertise in data lake architecture and data supply chains
Understanding of business intelligence tools and principles




This is a hybrid position with the requirement to work in the office 1 day/week.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Blue Boat Data Analyst / Senior Analyst




Blue Boat Data is an enterprise analytics SaaS company based out of New York city and Vancouver, Canada. We are a young company growing rapidly and building the next generation of Enterprise Intelligence software. Our leadership team has a combined 50 years+ of experience building and managing data, analytics, digital marketing and software across some of the world’s leading brands. We felt that there continued to be significant gaps in solutions that solved the problems we faced as users. That’s why we started Blue Boat Data.




BBD is looking for an outstanding Analyst to join our team. You will be responsible for analytics projects as well as analytics engineering to support our product roadmap. This role encompasses data analytics, SQL coding, report design, and product development.

You will be surrounded by a team of experts in the analytics, machine learning, software development space who themselves have deep experience working for some of the best known global brands. The opportunity to learn and grow with our company will be tremendous and exciting.







Key job responsibilities

• Talent for asking the right questions – to find the nuances, understand the key strategies that drive our customers’ businesses, to reveal the truth.

• Expert SQL user. Able to query complex data and translate numbers into business facing scalable reports.

• Skilled in designing and visualizing information. Always storytelling.

• Comfortable in questioning your own conclusions.

• Skilled in seeing patterns and themes in data. Masterful synthesizer (or a genuine passion to become).

• A great storyteller.

• A champion of helping our customers be successful.




Basic Qualifications




Expert SQL skills.
3+ years of work experience generating analytics on complex data sets. Experience with machine learning and statistical methods valuable. Two of those years must be in the field of consumer or digital marketing analytics. The job requires knowledge of B to C business models.
Superb verbal and written communication to communicate internally and with business partners.
The ability to identify and ask the right questions of our customers to understand the business problem we need to help them solve.
Comfort and ability to manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously.
Deep knowledge of Excel. Data visualization tools a plus. PowerPoint a super plus.
Native level English fluency

We are a young company growing rapidly and building the next generation of Enterprise Intelligence software. Our leadership team has a combined 50 years+ of experience building and managing data, analytics, digital marketing and software across some of the world’s leading brands. We felt that there continued to be significant gaps in solutions that solved the problems we faced as users. That’s why we started Blue Boat Data.


BBD is looking for an outstanding Analyst to join our team. You will be responsible for analytics projects as well as analytics engineering to support our product roadmap. This role encompasses data analytics, SQL coding, report design, and product development.

You will be surrounded by a team of experts in the analytics, machine learning, software development space who themselves have deep experience working for some of the best known global brands. The opportunity to learn and grow with our company will be tremendous and exciting.



Key job responsibilities

• Talent for asking the right questions – to find the nuances, understand the key strategies that drive our customers’ businesses, to reveal the truth.

• Expert SQL user. Able to query complex data and translate numbers into business facing scalable reports.

• Skilled in designing and visualizing information. Always storytelling.

• Comfortable in questioning your own conclusions.

• Skilled in seeing patterns and themes in data. Masterful synthesizer (or a genuine passion to become).

• A great storyteller.

• A champion of helping our customers be successful.


Basic Qualifications


  • Expert SQL skills.
  • 3+ years of work experience generating analytics on complex data sets. Experience with machine learning and statistical methods valuable. Two of those years must be in the field of consumer or digital marketing analytics. The job requires knowledge of B to C business models.
  • Superb verbal and written communication to communicate internally and with business partners.
  • The ability to identify and ask the right questions of our customers to understand the business problem we need to help them solve.
  • Comfort and ability to manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously.
  • Deep knowledge of Excel. Data visualization tools a plus. PowerPoint a super plus.
  • Native level English fluency

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Customer Analytics
Description:
TextNow is looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst to fuel the next stage of our growth. This person will work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to drive customer acquisition and retention. You will deliver deep, actionable insights in a timely manner to optimize & grow our business.

This role sits on the Business Analytics team. The mission of our team is to deliver timely and trustworthy insights that enhance clarity and instill confidence. This role will report to the Head of Data Science & Analytics.




What You’ll Do:
Be a strong partner to cross-functional teams by understanding new and existing Ads product offering and recommending the right metrics & experiments to measure performance
Enable our advertisers to achieve business results, with insights & measurement, such as those focused on customer and media
Provide cross-functional teams visibility into key business KPIs and metrics by developing and presenting reports and dashboards
Independently conduct analyses using rigorous analytic methods and build recommendations that drive decision making and business prioritization
Execute upon experimentation roadmaps by implementing experiments and tests, monitoring results and presenting recommendations
Generate and share actionable insights with Director+ level leadership via written artifacts such as decks and memos, and verbally in forums such as weekly standup meetings





Who You Are:
BA/BS in a quantitative discipline like Math, Computer Science, Economics or Analytics required. MS in Business Analytics highly preferred
3+ years of hands-on experience in business and/or product analytics, working with large, multi-dimensional datasets, preferably at fast-growing tech companies
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written
Skilled in extracting and transforming data from Snowflake warehouse using SQL
Hands-on experience in designing, building, operating, and maintaining Tableau dashboards
Knowledge of customer growth concepts such as CAC/LTV, retention curves, onboarding & activation funnels is preferred
Experience working with tools like MMPs (eg Adjust, AppsFlyer), CRM tools like Braze, web analytics (Google Analytics), product analytics & experimentation tools (Amplitude, Eppo, Mixpanel)
Experience in experimentation (A/B tests, geo tests etc.) and basic statistics (e.g hypothesis testing) required. Knowledge of commonly used analytic methods such as regression, decision trees and forecasting is highly preferred
Experience in and ability to play “trusted advisor” to senior and executive leadership and help make change happen
Fast learner. Being a fast learner also means the ability to admit defeat, ask for help and iterate quickly so you can learn from your mistakes and move ahead
Respectfully candid with the ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders as well as peers on the data team
Resourceful and scrappy with the ability to deliver insights to the right teams in a timely manner














More about TextNow...

Our Values:

·  Customer Obsessed (We strive to have a deep understanding of our customers)

·  Do Right By Our People (We treat each other with fairness, respect, and integrity)

·  Accept the Challenge (We adopt a "Yes, We Can" mindset to achieve ambitious goals)

·  Act Like an Owner (We treat this company like it's our own... because it is!)

·  Give a Damn! (We are deeply committed and passionate about our work and achieving results)

Benefits, Culture, & More:

·   Strong work life blend 

·   Flexible work arrangements (wfh, remote, or access to one of our office spaces)

·   Employee Stock Options 

·   Unlimited vacation 

·   Competitive pay and benefits

·   Parental leave

·   Benefits for both physical and mental well being (wellness credit and L&D credit)

·   We travel a few times a year for various team events, company wide off-sites, and more

Diversity and Inclusion:

At TextNow, our mission is built around inclusion and offering a service for EVERYONE, in an industry that traditionally only caters to the few who have the means to afford it. We believe that diversity of thought and inclusion of others promotes a greater feeling of belonging and higher levels of engagement. We know that if we work together, we can do amazing things, and that our differences are what make our product and company great. 

TextNow Candidate Policy

By submitting an application to TextNow, you agree to the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information in accordance with the TextNow Candidate Policy

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Bass Pro Shops and Cabela’s, we passionately serve people who enjoy the outdoor lifestyle by delivering innovation, quality, and value in our products and services. Live... Dream... Work the Adventure!




Summary:

Reporting to the E-commerce & Data Analytics Manager, the Data Analyst is responsible for the analysis of omnichannel sales, performance, and behavioral data. This position will require a technical skillset that includes daily use of SQL, DAX (Microsoft Power BI), and Python. This role requires an entrepreneurial outlook as we continue to find new ways to interpret and communicate actionable insights to key business stakeholders.




Location:

This position is a hybrid role that allows for 2 days of remote work and 3 days in the office. The office is located at 25 De Beats Street, Winnipeg, MB.




Responsibilities:

Build data visualization dashboards, tools, and infrastructure (Microsoft Power BI) that allow for the sharing of key metrics across multiple business groups.
Curate datasets from SQL databases to analyze and provide answers to a wide range of business inquiries.
Write codes to aid in data extraction and automation using APIs from internal and external sources.
Develop sales and KPI forecasts for omni-campaigns and eCommerce initiatives in collaboration with multiple departments.
Perform merchandise and product forecast analysis, transaction data analysis, seasonal merchandise demand analysis, and assist with customer lifetime value management reporting.
Support the digital marketing and eCommerce teams with actionable insights from data collected from tools that support social media, email, on-site personalization, and paid media.
Translate raw data and marketing results into easy-to-understand findings, including preparation of executive summaries and business reviews.
Aid in data validation to ensure accuracy of shared visualizations and datasets.
Other duties as assigned.




Qualifications:

Post-secondary education in computer science, statistics, or equivalent work experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role
2+ years of proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
A minimum of 1-year experience working with SQL and Python
Demonstrated experience with BI Tools (MS Power BI preferred)
Experience gathering data from varying sources using APIs
Experience interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques
Google Cloud Platform experience is an asset
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and creative solution-building mindset
Ability to translate data into actionable insights
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to prioritize work with good time-management skills
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Visual Basic)
Adapts to change in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment




Benefits:

Hybrid work from home options on Wednesdays & Fridays
Immediate employee discount
Fun work environment
Competitive wages
Excellent benefits
Unlimited career advancement opportunities







Bass Pro Shops & Cabela’s welcomes applications from people with disabilities.

Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Location: Remote - EST time

Duration: 8 - month contract




Top Skills Required:

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Well-rounded experience in the whole data lifecycle management and hands-on experience in the following data management domains: dimensional and relational data modeling, data quality, SQL programming, ETL development, metadata management and master data management, business intelligence and database administration.
Experience with reverse engineering the source to target mapping to gain data insights




Other Skills Required:

Experience with Azure Data Platform technologies or other public cloud offerings
Experience with IBM: Data Manager, InfoSphere DataStage
Experience with Spark SQL
Programming experience: SQL, R, Python
Experience with Power BI report development
Understanding of Denodo platform
Excellent verbal and written communication, critical thinking, time management, priority planning and interpersonal skills.
Ability to understand and interpret requirements and design documents
Ability to write and maintain documentation




Assets:

Experience working in an Agile environment/team
Bilingualism in both official languages (English and French)

Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
BI Data Analyst




Apex Systems is a large staffing and consulting firm and we are looking for a BI Data Analyst with strong SQL skills, data visualization tools experience - specifically Power BI and SAS, and strong communication skills to place at our client, a top Financial Institution.




Client: Financial Institution

Contract/Perm & duration: 1 year-Contract

Location: Downtown Toronto (2 days/week onsite)

Project: Data Analytics Team in Wealth Management to improve business insights.




Job Description:

Builds various reporting dashboards using the most appropriate data extraction, data cleaning and data visualization techniques.
Provides value through insights, reporting and data visualization techniques. Selects, configures and implements analytics solutions for consistency and repeatability.
Researches and applies continuous improvement in data visualization by identifying trends and patterns to transform raw data into actionable business insights.
Works with different teams, management and stakeholders to enhance the usability and aesthetic appeal of data analytics solutions deployed in the organization.
Translates business needs to technical specifications and evaluates existing data visualization systems in order to improve them.
Develops data visualizations of "large" amounts of data that facilitate the intuitive presentation of data to decision makers.
Documents data flow, systems and processes to improve the design, implementation and management of business/group processes.
Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences.
Focus is primarily on business/group within Wealth Management domain; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.




Key Qualifications:

5+ years experience as a Data Analyst
Experience with major querying tools desired
Coordinating others work while involved with multiple business work streams
Experience working within SAS platform
Strong expertise in SQL, and data visualization tools (i.e. Power BI, Tableau etc.)
Experience with AWS preferred
Ability to communicate strategies and processes around business insights
Ability to influence multiple levels on highly technical issues and challenges

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Position Summary:

As a Business Data Analyst, you will play a key role in analyzing and interpreting data from multiple sources, leverage data driven insights and advanced analytics to help guide strategic business decisions, optimize processes and improve operational efficiency. This role requires a strong technical skill. The ideal candidate possesses strong analytical mindset and a strong problem-solving skill and can translate complex datasets into actionable business recommendations.

Position Responsibilities May Include, But Not Limited To

Data Support


Monitor and troubleshoot data refresh processes for BI reports and dashboards.
Work with the team to identify and resolve data inconsistencies and errors.
Collaborate with IT and data engineers to maintain and optimize data pipelines.
Maintain documentation for data refresh schedules, configurations, and issue resolutions.
Assist in user support for report access and functionality issues.
Proactively suggest improvements to enhance data reliability and efficiency


Data Analysis & Interpretation


Extract, clean, and analyze large datasets from multiple data sources (JDE, KOMPASS, MBSYNC, Samsara, Paragon, among others) and data warehouse (Snowflake) to provide comprehensive insights into business performance.
Conduct deep-dive analyses to identify patterns, trends, and relationships in the data that will inform key business decisions.
Assist in the design and deployment of Prescriptive analysis to support process optimization and data insights.
Perform root cause analysis of business challenges and recommend data-driven solutions.
Identify opportunities for process improvements, cost reductions, and efficiency gains using data.
Ensure data quality and accuracy through proper validation techniques, best practices and governance processes


Reporting and Visualization


Design, develop, and maintain complex reports, dashboards, and visualizations using business intelligence tool like Power BI
Collaborate with department heads to define and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) relevant to the company’s strategic goals.
Translate business questions into data requirements and provide concise answers through reporting.


Machine learning and AI integration


Work with the data science team to identify opportunities to integrate machine learning and AI into business processes
Assist in the design, development, and deployment of machine learning/AI models to automate decision-making processes and optimize operations
Evaluate the results of machine learning models, ensuring they align with business objectives
Stay updated on the latest technology solution and integrate new techniques into business workflow


Stakeholder Collaboration


Work closely with various business units (Operations &Transportation, Finance, Supply Chain, ROP, REX, Centralized Routing) to understand their business needs and develop tailored technical solutions
Provide regular presentations of data insights, reports, and recommendations to senior management and executive leadership
Serve as the liaison between technical teams (Data ingestion, Data Engineers) and business stakeholders to ensure alignment in data strategies and technology implementations


Data Quality & Governance


Maintain data integrity, ensure data accuracy, and establish best practices for data collection, validation, and governance
Identify data gaps and work with data ingestion and IT teams to improve data architecture and system integrations
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and internal data governance policies


Project Management


Lead or participate in cross-functional projects focused on leveraging data to drive innovation and continuous improvement
Track project milestones, manage timelines, and ensure successful delivery of data-related projects within deadlines
Other projects or duties as assigned


Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience:


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Science or a related field. Master’s degree preferred.
2+ years of experience in data analysis and visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau and Qlik
Willingness to learn and understand business operations across business units
Strong knowledge of data warehousing, ETL processes, SQL, DAX, M-Query, data source and data warehouse (Snowflake)
Familiarity with R scripting and Python.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate and present complex ideas and data insights clearly and effectively to non-technical
stakeholders.Eagerness to learn new technologies especially in ML/AI space
Collaborative mindset with a focus on driving innovative solutions
Attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy
This position must pass a post-offer background check


Physical Demands And Work Environment

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Due to the nature of our business in regard to such things as delivery schedules, order inputs, selection, and Department of Transportation Hours of Service, overtime, attendance and punctuality are essential job functions. Should an individual in this classification not be able to adhere to this requirement due to a disability, they should contact their Human Resources department to see what, if any, reasonable accommodation may be made.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Net2Source Inc. is an award-winning total workforce solutions company recognized by Staffing Industry Analysts for our accelerated growth of 300% in the last 3 years with over 5500+ employees globally, with over 30+ locations in the US and global operations in 32 countries. We believe in providing staffing solutions to address the current talent gap – Right Talent – Right Time – Right Place – Right Price and acting as a Career Coach to our consultants.




Company: One of Our Clients

Job Description:

Title - Data Analyst

Location - Remote role located in Ontario or Montreal, Canada

Duration: 06+ Months (Extendable)




Pay Rate - $38.84 per hour on T4




Bilingual (French/English)




Description:

Job Profile Summary Create analytics and reporting for the Agent Review team to identify and assess patterns, track findings, and detect and mitigate risk.




Responsibilities

• Participate in the development of reporting metrics and dashboards in collaboration with the Agent Review and Compliance teams.

• Use analytics technologies including MSBI, Excel, SQL, SSIS, Power BI, to develop and maintain data, data extracts, and reporting.

• Initiate, review, track and provide reporting for client and agent file reviews performed by the Agent Review team.

• Build automations using Excel, SQL, and Power BI.

• Assist in the development of reporting that identifies statistics, trends, and training opportunities for the sales field.

• Document processes related to data warehousing, extracting, automations, analysis, and reporting.

• Extract, transform, and load data using data management tools and T-SQL.

• Administer and maintain the BI Portal, data warehouse, and existing BI solutions.

• Assist management in conducting and facilitating internal testing and user acceptance testing.

• Analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skills

• Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

• Excellent communication and relationship building skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a data-driven professional with a passion for digital analytics? Join a leading Digital Banking team as an Analytics Consultant (Senior Data Analyst) and help shape digital sales strategies using cutting-edge Adobe tools. This is a fantastic opportunity to work on high-impact projects, collaborate with top-tier professionals, and contribute to optimizing customer journeys.




What You’ll Do:

Lead and deliver Adobe and Google Analytics architecture, design, and implementation for digital strategy initiatives and marketing campaigns.
Collaborate with Marketing and Sales teams to implement and measure project KPIs using advanced analytics solutions.
Partner with technology vendors to oversee configurations, governance, and integrations of vendor products.
Conduct weekly assessments of digital alerts and audit metrics, continuously seeking automation and enhancement opportunities.
Stay informed on evolving privacy laws to ensure compliance and mitigate potential risks.




Must-Have Qualifications:

2-5 years of experience in digital analytics, with expertise in: Adobe/Google Analytics, Third-party SDK integrations, Digital tagging & tracking, Campaign tracking, A/B testing & client journey personalization, Tactics optimization
Strong understanding of customer data and analytics platforms, including Customer Data Platforms (CDP) and Adobe Experience Platform (AEP).
Experience with MarTech product engineering, platform architecture, and data development.
Knowledge of federal and provincial data privacy laws and industry best practices.
Strong project management, communication, and relationship-building skills.
Ability to provide both quantitative and qualitative analytical insights.




Nice-to-Have Qualifications:

Degree in business, math, marketing, finance, information management, statistics, or a related field.
Experience in data modeling and statistical methodologies.
Familiarity with ObservePoint and automated tagging/validation techniques.




Why Apply?

Innovative Environment: Work with leading-edge Adobe and Google Analytics tools.
Impactful Work: Play a key role in enhancing digital sales strategies within a top-tier banking institution.
Collaborative Team: Be part of a dynamic team of eight professionals, working closely with leadership and project teams.




Join us in driving data-driven decision-making and optimizing digital experiences. Apply today!

Show more

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
About League

Founded in 2014, and with a total funding currently at $220 million; League is a platform technology company powering next-generation healthcare consumer experiences. Payers, providers, consumer health partners and employers build on League’s platform to deliver high-engagement, personalized healthcare experiences consumers love. Millions of people use solutions powered by League to access, navigate and pay for care.

The role

As a Customer Data Analyst, you will work with customers to help them better understand the unique digital engagement data that our platform generates that informs our ability to create engaging products and features that improve the health outcomes of our users. In this role, you will use in-depth analysis and governance of business intelligence, to depict the value of the League platform to enable and drive improvements to the customer experience and engagement that lead to improved patient health outcomes! You will surface key performance indicators with visual analytics platforms like Looker and Amplitude and work closely with other data analysts, engineers and scientists on the team to support the data models underlying the visual analysis dashboards/tools.

People who enjoy working within cross-functional and multi-disciplined teams both internally and externally will thrive in this role. Furthermore, you have experience in tying numbers to a larger, more strategic, business context. You enjoy communicating with non-technical stakeholders, using the art of converting simple questions into complex analysis and translating them back into meaningful and actionable insights.

Meet the Team

Our data team also manages an internal Business Intelligence product that primarily leverages a SQL-based ETL to surface key performance indicators company-wide within Looker. You will be working closely with data engineers and data scientists on the team to build and maintain our data pipelines to ingest and transform data from a variety of sources to support these BI tools.

In This Role, You Will


Support League’s customers in using our data to unlock insights on their end users using your expertise with data models and BI, managing data dictionaries, and deep dive and Q&A sessions.
Work closely with internal stakeholders to provide insights through analysis to help inform decisions in all parts of the business, including Product Management, Marketing, and Health Care.
Act as a SME for all things related to Reporting; guide users to the right set of KPIs and provide clarity on their meaning.
Develop analytics strategies and frameworks to monitor and analyze product performance and business KPIs related to application usage, and user engagement & conversion.
Work with data analysts, data engineers and data scientists on data requirements, reporting and forecasting of metrics and building out visualizations and data value stories.
Regularly conduct data quality audits and analysis to ensure the accuracy of data & reports sent to customers, in particular of the client events (ie clickstream data) generated by user button clicks and screen loads within the app.


Who You Are


You care deeply about using information and data in decision-making and have experience in communicating that logic to customers.
You are a strong communicator and enjoy collaborating with groups and training or educating teams to use data tools or to understand results.
You are a strong problem solver and can communicate the challenges and solutions effectively.
You are extremely customer-centric and create relationships with customers easily.
You like working in a fast-paced environment and are comfortable managing multiple tasks to tight deadlines.
You are eager to learn from others and help others grow with you.


What You Bring


Strong SQL skills, comfortable working with python
Experience working with data pipeline orchestration such as Airflow or Dataflow
Experience working with data engineering stack on cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or GCP.
At least two years of experience working as a data engineer, analytics engineer, data analyst or data scientist
Undergraduate or Masters degree in business administration, statistics, computer science or similarly quantitative discipline, or equivalent practical experience


Nice To Have Experience


Data analysis and data manipulation in Python (Pandas, PySpark, etc)
Healthcare industry experience
Worked with a SaaS company on customer facing data products
Backend Software Engineering experience and understanding


What We Offer


Comprehensive Health Benefits: We prioritize your well-being with complete medical, dental, and vision coverage
Bonus Program: Be rewarded for your contributions with our performance-based bonus program
Employee Stock Option Program: Become an owner and share in our success through our stock option program
Unlimited Paid Time Off: Take the time you need to recharge and maintain a healthy work-life balance
Spending Accounts: Manage your healthcare and dependent care expenses with tax-advantaged spending accounts
Wellness Days: Prioritize your mental and physical health with dedicated wellness days throughout the year
Growth Opportunities: We invest in your future with abundant opportunities for professional development and advancement
Mentorship Program: Benefit from guidance and support from experienced leaders in your field
Flexible Ways of Working: Enjoy the freedom to work in a way that suits your life and boosts your productivity


The Application Process

We believe applying for a job should be straightforward and transparent. Here’s what to expect:


Submit Your Application: You’ll receive a confirmation email right away.
Hiring Manager interview: Discuss your experience, skills, and motivations relevant to the specific job requirements
Talent Interview: Learn more about our culture, get alignment on your compensation expectation prior to committing to next steps
Meet the Data Team: Dive into technical discussions and learn how you can make an impact at League.
Final Steps: Meet our cross-functional team and the Executive leader and share experiences on collaboration and alignment with company values and strategic goals
Offer and onboarding!


We value your time and effort—our team is committed to providing updates throughout the process.

Security-related Responsibilities


Compliance with Information Security Policies
Compliance with League’s secure coding practice
Responsibility and accountability for executing League's policies and procedures
Notification of HR, Legal, Compliance & Security of any incidents, breaches or policy violations


CANADA APPLICANTS ONLY: The Canada-specific compensation range below for this full-time position is exclusive of bonus, equity and benefits. This range reflects the minimum and maximum target for base salaries for the position across all Canadian locations. Where in the band you may land is determined by job-related skills/experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range specific to your skills and experience during the hiring process.

Compensation range for Canada applicants only

$99,200—$124,000 CAD

Our employees come from different backgrounds, and we celebrate those differences. We are looking for the best candidates for our open roles, but do not expect applicants to meet every qualification in order to be considered. If you are excited about what you could accomplish at League and believe you can add value to our team, we would love to hear from you.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you are an individual in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at recruitinginfo@league.com.

Our Application Process

Applying to a role you love can be exhausting, and understanding the next steps can feel vague and uncertain. You have done the hard part of submitting your application; let's do ours by sharing potential next steps


You should receive a confirmation email after submitting your application.
A recruiter (not a computer) reviews all applications at League.
If we see alignment with League's needs, a recruiter will reach out to learn more about your goals. The recruiter will also share the team-specific interview process depending on the roles you are exploring.
The final step is an offer, which we hope you will accept!
Prior to joining us, we conduct reference and background checks. Additional checks could be required for US Candidates, depending on the role you are exploring.


Here are some additional resources to learn more about League:


Learn about our platform, leadership team and partners
Highmark Health, Google Cloud, League: new digital front door to seamless care
Former Providence President and Workday EVP of Corporate Strategy join League Board of Directors
League raises $95 million USD in Series C to build world’s leading healthcare CX platform
Forbes x League: The Platformization Of Healthcare Is Here
Fast Company x League: If we want better innovations in healthtech, we need more competition


Recognize and Avoid Employment scams. Practice safe job searching.

Scammers are getting craftier and leveraging fake job postings to get personal information. Know the warning signs and protect yourself from scammers. Learn more here.

Privacy Policy

Review our Privacy Policy for information on how League is protecting personal data.

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI/SQL Developer)
Description:
Choose a workplace that empowers your impact.

Join a global workplace where employees thrive. One that embraces diversity of thought, expertise and experience. A place where you can personalize your employee journey to be — and deliver — your best.

We are a purpose-driven, dynamic and sustainable pension plan. An industry leading global investor with teams in Toronto to London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. We embody the values of our 600,000+ members, placing their best interests at the heart of everything we do.

Join us to accelerate your growth & development, prioritize wellness, build connections, and support the communities where we live and work.

Don’t just work anywhere — come build tomorrow together with us.

Know someone at OMERS or Oxford Properties? Great! If you're referred, have them submit your name through Workday first. Then, watch for a unique link in your email to apply.

We are seeking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our Pension Products & Technology team in Toronto. The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of hands-on experience in data analysis, leveraging tools such as Power BI, SQL, Python, and Excel to deliver advanced analytics, develop insightful dashboards, and create impactful reports that drive data-informed decisions. This is a fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst to work with cutting-edge data analytical tools while being part of a dynamic Pension Data team that fosters collaboration, encourages innovation, and supports professional growth.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Data Collection & Integration


Collect data from multiple sources, such as databases, APIs, or external systems.
Integrate data from various sources, ensuring that it’s accurate, consistent, and complete.
Manage large datasets and ensure the proper storage and retrieval processes are in place.
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing
Clean and preprocess raw data to remove errors, inconsistencies, or duplicate entries.
Transform data into a structured format suitable for analysis, applying necessary formatting or aggregation techniques.
Validate data to ensure its accuracy and integrity before performing analysis.


Data Analysis & Interpretation


Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and relationships that can provide insights.
Use statistical methods and predictive models to address business problems and support decision-making.
Perform descriptive and exploratory analysis to understand key metrics and KPIs.
Reporting & Visualization
Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate data insights clearly and effectively using Power BI and Excel.
Automate recurring reports to improve efficiency and ensure timely delivery of insights.
Present findings to stakeholders with clear, actionable insights through reports and presentations.


Collaboration & Communication


Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, product teams, and development engineering teams, to understand data requirements and deliver insights.
Translate complex data into understandable terms for non-technical stakeholders.
Work closely with team members to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and measurement frameworks.


Continuous Learning and Improvement


Identify opportunities to improve existing data processes and analytical techniques.
Keep up with the latest trends and best practices in data analysis, visualization, and tools.
Experiment with new methods and tools to enhance the quality and speed of data analysis.


Data Governance & Quality Assurance


Ensure data security, privacy, and compliance with regulations during the collection and analysis process.
Implement processes for quality control to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.
Monitor and audit data sources for consistency and potential issues over time.
Ad-Hoc SQL Query Development & Analysis
Develop SQL Queries & Conduct ad-hoc analysis to address immediate data requests and to provide urgent data insights.


Documentation & Knowledge Sharing


Document analysis methods, assumptions, and results for transparency and reproducibility.
Share insights and learnings with the broader team, contributing to a knowledge-sharing culture.


To Succeed In This Role, You Have


Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
5 years of hands-on experience in Data analysis, Power BI development and SQL Query Development.
Strong proficiency in Power BI, including Power Query, Power BI Service, and Power BI Desktop.
Expertise in DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) for creating measures, calculated columns and complex DAX expressions.
Must have experience building semantic data models in Power BI
Experience working with relational databases and data warehousing concepts.
Proficiency in SQL and Python for querying and transforming data.
A team player and motivated self-starter
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Experience with Azure Data Services (Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Factory)
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Strong Understanding of DB Pension Knowledge is an asset.


We believe that time together in the office is important for OMERS and Oxford, the strength of our employees, and the work we do for our pension members. In delivering on our pension promise, keeping us connected to our work and each other, our flexible hybrid work guideline requires teams to come in to the office 1+ days per week

As one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, our people-first culture is at its best when our workforce reflects the communities where we live and work — and the members we proudly serve.

From hire to retire, we are an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process that extends all the way through your employee experience. This sense of belonging and connection is cultivated up, down and across our global organization thanks to our vast network of Employee Resource Groups with executive leader sponsorship, our Purpose@Work committee and employee recognition programs.
